description:
I keep loving going here!!  It's spacious without bumping into other people AND not too many people crowd into here like boogaloo's AND their prices as usual are great for the large plateful of food they give you!!  They have large round tables so it's great for groups and families.  

Again, do NOT come here for gourmet food, the freshest, the bestest, etc.  It's just the usual decently cooked Chinese food, but if you're in the area (because you have to deal with Social Security or go to SF City College's 22nd St branch) and afterwards are hungry for hot prepared food quickly, it's a great choice for the budget conscious and for anyone who doesn't like feeling pressured to eat fast, pay fast, and leave fast for the next crowd to come in which I hate from other places!! Across the street is a parking lot if there's no street parking.  I come in the daytime when the young waitress is there and she's HELPFUL!!  She works way harder than a lot of employees I've seen at many restaurants, even Asian ones.  

The food is as usual LARGE PORTIONS as I enjoyed chomping my way thru my Everest mountain of hot cooked well-flavored BBQ pork rice and I was definitely HUNGRY!!  Their Korean chicken was a tummyful, so crispy & tasty!!  I asked for hot cautiously, but when I got it, it wasn't too hot.  It was more sweet than hot.  The heat was pretty mild.  

Their lunch specials have more rice than actual rice/veggies so if you are NOT especially hungry, go for the discount lunch special.  If you're definitely hungry, go for the separate meals/fried rice/noodles OR try 2 lunch specials.  

For sure, if you have 2 people, if you just order 1 order of fried rice and an entree meal, you can half them for you both and it will be less than $20.  If you're only 1 person ordering them, you'll for sure be taking home a doggie bag of food!!
author: Frugal C.

description: Disappointing food. The Chow Mein noodles was sopping wet in a watery sauce and the noodles were stuck together.
author: Leeyen R.

description: Okay. Delivery fast and the delivery lady was so nice. Food okay until I started eating the Rice Seafood Soup, there is zero seafood in it and I was like oh well, and then looked down to see what was in it and found a dead  small warm and spider. Really? I don't remember ordering my food with extra protein. Just disgusting. One of the reasons I always cook at home is this. Today I have a fever and couldn't get up and cook and really regret it.
author: Amal K.

description: This place has great tasting food for s good price (especially if you do the meal deals). Highly recommended!
author: Robyn M.

description: I've been going to this place for years. Nice people and good food. Especially the korean chicken.
author: Gabriel C.

description: I've been coming there for decades since I was a kid. My dad would bring this home. Always Korean chicken, chow mein, fried rice, and friend prawns. This is the best Chinese food in San Francisco.
author: Miguel P.

description: In the Mission district SF is this hole in the wall Chinese restaurant . A group of us ordered family style; salted dried fish/diced chicken fried rice, Chinese broccoli stir fried, chow fun, chow mein, stir fry seafood with mixed greens and their absolutely delicious fried chicken.  The pieces of chicken was just the right temperature hot with a sweet saucy glaze .  If it wasn't for the chicken, I don't know if I would come here again.  The rest of the food was nothing to write home about, because it wasn't tasty.
author: Mabe S.

description:
Got take-out and had a decent experience. Got a combo with orange chicken and pork Chow mein. Nothing really to write home about but the food was tasty with big portions. 
4 stars for the good value!
author: Joon Kee P.

description: 4-star food at 5-star prices. One of my go-to Chinese food restaurants in the Mission.
author: Freddy Z.

description: OMG. OMG. OMG. THIS IS THE BEST PLACE. We had the pork friend rice. Lemon and orange chicken. KOREAN CHICKEN is better than sex. Chow fun combination with black bean sauce. Chow mein pepper beef with black bean sauce. I bring all my guests here and they leave astonished. Had friends here from Finland. France. And all over the USA. It os amazing!!!
author: Steven A.

description: Came hear on my lunchbreak & ordered the beef bok choy over rice. When the food arrived the lady placed my plate down & said is beef w/mixed veggie ok? Like i have a choice? I said but thats not what i ordered. Sorry she said. Mind u i was on my break. Wish I took a pic but i put the brocolli and carrots aside and just ate the minimal bok choy given. Soo not cool.
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a kid and I still love it! I only order the soup, chow mein, beef in oyster sauce, and Korean chicken wings. 

It's my favorite won to soup, outside of Hong Kong. And the Korean Chicken is pretty bomb. 

My Chinese friends like it too! I think that says a lot.
author: Mitzi G.

description: Went here based on a recommendation from a colleague and simply got the Korean fried chicken and was not disappointed. Sweet delicious tasting chicken wings ,would return to get some to go for sure.
author: Rod M.

description: Returned to visit the 4th generation after being away for 20 plus years.  Still yummy!
author: Ben L.

description:
Been going here for over 30 years, and with 10 minutes to closing time took my phone order and stayed open 15 minutes after closing for me to get there and pick up my order.

I now live in San Jose, and I will drive to SF just to get dinner at Heung Yuen.

I recommend: Korean chicken, pot stickers, BBQ fried Rice's and every time the Wor Won ton soup, and chicken chow fun...flavor to die for. Here I'm just naming a few of the yummy and some of my fav's.

While the Mission District has tons of food options and delicious places.. this one is a must. When looking for a Chinese food run, or soup for feeling sick or hungover.
author: Sara C.

description: No good! This was suppose to be our first delicious in San Francisco but it was a fail. The food came out cold, the broccoli was not clean so it tasted bitter, the meat was not cooked properly. Top to it all off there was flys all over our food. Such a disappointment.
author: Hector B.

description: Perfect for a quick and cheap lunch. No muss no fuss.
author: Robert L.

description: My family has been coming here for years, the food is delicious and the price is unbeatable, portions are generous as well. Best wonton soup in the city, hands down!
author: Jasmine T.

description: Great Chinese food. Ordered some chow fun and rice with vegetables plus a spring roll. Classic flavor. Price is cheap.
author: Chris L.

description: I ate here for dinner at 8PM and got food poisoning around 2AM. I'm writing this post in between bathroom runs. Honestly blaming myself for not checking the health score before eating here and not listening to myself when I knew the Mongolian beef tasted off. I'm good at smelling/tasting food that's gone bad but I ignored my instincts when my friend who I was sharing the dish with had no complaints. I'll be having to call out of work tomorrow thanks to this place selling rotten meat.
author: Sarah L.

description: my favorite place to eat since I was kid, but then I got sick not sure if they used the same oil but I can't eat Chinese food anymore
author: Jennifer B.

description:
This is a challenging review for me as some things were stellar, and others substandard. 
This was my first time to the restaurant and I got takeout. The service was friendly and timely, so no complaints about that.
Whenever I try out a new Chinese restaurant I always try their Wonton soup and their Egg Foo Young (if it's on the menu) as those 2 dishes seem the easiest to F'up and I've had the worst experiences with in the past.
They DO serve EFY but it's veggie, and I made the mistake of adding chicken. Clearly, their chicken is pre-cooked and they just add it to dishes when ordered, so this resulted in tough, dry pieces of meat in my dish (-1*). It would have been amazing w/o the chicken.
My first bite also included a piece of egg shell, as did my second and 20th or so bites. (-1*)
Next, the wonton soup. 
They have Wor Wonton which has everything in it, so I went for that. The flavor was great, the soup had more ingredients than ANY other WW soup I've ever ordered, but the wonton wrappers were SUPER pasty and soggy (-1*).
So overall, I would eat here again. 
Their prices and portion size are commendable in this ridiculous market, and the flavor was good overall. If not for some consistency and careless additions, it would have garnered a higher rating.
author: D C.

description: Definitely the best standard no frills Chinese food I've ever eaten. The orange chicken was crispy yet tender in the middle and the Mongolian beef pieces had great flavor and nice traces of heat (note it's not spicy). The pieces of meat felt hearty not like the typical super pounded almost fake tasting typical meat served at other places
author: Genica R.

description:
Cheap, quick and dirty. Come here for giant potions of the greasy crispy tasty Chinese classics that may or may not taste better after a few drinks. The menu is a novel, of course. Has every combo of fried rice/noodles that you could ask for. 

Walnut prawns were crispy and the shrimp texture was great. 

BBQ pork chow mein was the biggest portion imaginable and had okay flavor with a couple strips of pork. Great value!
author: Tasha H.

description:
This is The Best Chinese Food in San Francisco!!!!
Been coming here for many years and I've never had anything come close to their won ton soup or their sweet n spicy Korean shrimp  or chicken!!
author: G G.

description: Dank city! Love this spot! Wish they were open longer but I still frequent when I can. I absolutely love the Korean Fried Chicken wings! I get lost in the sauce!
author: Xavier G.

description:
My favorite Chinese restaurant in the City. I'm a native of SF's Mission district, where we lived down the street & this was the spot for family celebrations. I remember as a kid, turning the lazy Susan table top as we anxiously waited for our meal. Now as an adult, this is still by far--the go-to for amazing Chino food. 

Personal favs: Boneless Korean chicken, house chow mein, shrimp fried rice, honey walnut prawns, Mongolian beef, & wonton soup. Yummy! 

Great food & the staff are so warm & friendly. Ricky (staff) is the dude! You won't be disappointed. Try it out. :)
author: Jacqueline R.

description: I always come here and order the same thing chicken zucchini with oyster sauce substitute the black bean sauce that comes with For oyster  sauce and garlic make a little spicy well-done I always order the same thing so soon as I get here there you know what I want that's a fuss when you just want to eat and run
author: Jeannine P.

description: I've been going there since I was 6 or 7 years old. Family favorite and now I take my kids there as well. Best Korean Chicken. The Fried Fish with Oyster sauce is excellent as well.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Impeccable service and some of the best Chinese food I've ever had! We all had different dishes and everything was just perfect. The fried dishes were absolutely delicious and the crispy chicken was made of magic. Great value for money as well - highly recommend
author: Dorthea F.

description: Simply the best Korean chicken ever! Suggesting dishes are pork fried rice, beef chow main and chow fung.
author: Cyndy V.

description:
If you want to grab some inexpensive and fast Chinese food, this is the place to be. Service was ok, I ordered that day's special Zucchini and beef rice plate for 5.99, the portion was good but the beef was kinda flavorless, had to add a bunch of chili oil and soy sauce; I could taste the rice they used for their steamed rice is not so fresh. I also ordered HK style milk tea which tasted pretty much like water, I also ordered a Singaporean chow fun to go and that was pretty tasty, though it cost a bit more than the daily special, 7.50. 

I'm come mainland China, in my opinion this place is just another typical Chinese restaurant in the States. I think I'd go back when I crave for Chinese food when I'm in this area because their food is so cheap.
author: Yilang L.

description: I love this food we travel across the bridge to eat here traffic or not.   The sweet and spicy Korean wings are the best!  Excellent customer service from Ricky.
author: Rochelle H.

description:
So  I went to this place because it had 4 stars and the food looked really yummy. I ordered orange chicken over rice, chicken chow mein and the korean chicken wings. 
The wings are sooo tasty they are pretty good compared to the other food I ordered. Like in other reviews mention I agree they are a bit too sweet but still pretty good. The only thing is that they are really greasy. The orange chicken over rice I got had a hair in the rice which completly grossed me out so I ended up throwing that in the trash. The chicken chow mein has no kind of flavor at all i swear panda express's chow mein is so much better then this one. The only reason why its getting 2 stars is cause the korean wings are good.
author: Gabriela R.

description: Been going here for years for affordable and good tasting Chinese food in the mission
author: Sandra G.

description: A few good dishes and others are nothing special.  The plus is the fact that they don't over use salt so the flavors are better.  The minus is that the dishes are mostly cabbage and onions with relatively small portions of protein.
author: Elena S.

description: I am so saddened to write this review. For an establishment that had such high reviews in a city that I expected to be one of the most discerning when it comes to Chinese food, I am truly shocked .  We ordered takeout on our second last night in the city. I even spoke to the guy in Cantonese.   The sweet sour pork tasted like it had been reheated from the fridge in the microwave.  The fried rice was tasteless.  So sad.
author: Christopher Q.

description: Best Chinese food in Fairfield hands down! The service is okay but the food is delicious.
author: Nancy R.

description:
Yuck. Relatively empty restaurant, waited 20 minutes to be noticed and even get a menu / take an order - even though I was sitting front and center. I was also one of three tables. 

Someone had vomited on the table / floor - don't blame them, maybe they were sick. But it was incredibly unsightly to be left there like that. Food was cheap but entirely flavourless, left a sandy taste in your mouth. MSG af. Maybe I had a particularly bad experience - this place has been around for a while but will never come back.
author: Anna H.

description:
Pros: best damn Korean sauce for (I prefer) chicken wings both bone one and boneless as well as breaded shrimp. Daily special (#c) comes with 4 party wings, choice of chow mein, and egg drop soup.

Cons; sometimes chicken is too bad he for sure is to breaded. Location of restrooms seems a bit unsanitary right behind the open kitchen. staff isn't always the most prompt or socially friendly.
author: Mel L.

description:
This place has been around since I've been a child and my family used to bring me in the 80's. Surprised it's still around with all the gentrification going on in the Mission. This place still looks the same from back in the day. If it ain't broke, don't fix
It. The Korean wings are my favorite here and you can't go wrong with them. They have this sauce that is so addicting. Also got an order of combo chow mein which was super greasy. I've tried other dishes here which aren't that good too, but those Korean wings. Just come here for those!
author: EccentricAura A.

description: Love this place. Great food, very efficient and fast service.  I have been coming here since I was about 8 years old. Place has not changed other than they take credit cards now.
author: Mila R.

description: Went there today and the service sucked. Absolutely awful... What can I expect from a cheap Chinese restaurant but you don't want to get yelled at when you ask for a favor. Watch out for the small lady with glasses. Just do not talk to her. Otherwise she will come after you and get you. Anyways it's a perfect place if you wanna eat using dirty utensils and with your food on a sticky dirty table with a waitress yelling and complaining in your face about you and other customers... Never again.. Sayonara~
author: MIN K.

description: Its a place that's been in the Mission forever.  Usually not crowded.  Fast Chinese food with hardly any meat in there.  Portion is big but not very good.  The place been lost in time, very old decor.  How do they get 4 stars???
author: Mar H.

description: I had the Beef and Broccoli and my hubby the Green Beans and Chicken over rice. The food was very good,fresh and light. I enjoyed it very much.
author: Marie H.

description: I've been coming here since I was in middle school. It has not changed at all, and I highly recommend their korean chicken (bone in), with their house fried rice. That is a meal on its own. You will not be disappointed. I come here any chance I get, and every time I have family members that come in from out of town, this is the 1st place they want to stop and eat at.
author: Tasi A.

description: I ordered the vegetable chow mein which was a really huge portion of noodles, but it wasn't a lot of vegetables and extremely greasy. Had to give it away to someone on the street :/
author: Elena N.

description:
Really disgusted & disappointed. 
I was an occasional takeout customer for 20+ years. 
Ordered my same thing:  the Korean Chicken & a Steamed Rice to go. 
My order this past week was better suited for the Recology Green Compost Bin.
Korean Wings looked great, but every single wing was broken.   Only 1 piece was an unbroken drum-stickette.
These broken wings should of gone into making chicken stock.  Oh never mind.  Previous reviews mention the lack of flavour in their soups. 
A food establishment that values their patrons would not serve this rubbish.  
Secondly,  my order of steam rice appeared normal.   Maybe the upper portion was fresh?  IDK.   About 1/2 way down the container, I served myself steamed rice with a cauliflower floret.  
Where did the cauliflower come from?   I've been eating steamed rice forever.  I know the cauliflower would not survive the steam rice cooking cycle. 
Beware of getting used/recycled steamed rice from bussed tables.   Damn gross.   No worries.  They will not see me ever again.  

**This review has me giving them 5 negative stars.**
author: Helen D.

description:
Pretty standard Chinese food place in the Mission.

Has both authentic and westernized Chinese food, which is good. The decor inside looks like the place has been around for a while, and the food certainly reflects that as well. The scrambled egg with rice was not bad--a little on the dry side, and a bit salty.

The place looks like it's family owned--I'm sure it can earn much more if it steps up the vibe to cater to the Mission hipster crowd, but looks like the family store is here to stay, which is good.

All in all, a decent Chinese food place.
author: Henry L.

description: I've always loved this place and always visit when I'm in the area. The chicken mushroom (I add broccoli and go heavy on the sauce) is my fave. There's brown rice options available. Pot stickers aren't crispy but it tastes good w/ the vinegar and hot sauce. Korean chicken is a popular item which my friends always get. Hot and sour soup is more tart than spicy but not bad. Fried rice can be bland but just add soy sauce.
author: Julie L.

description:
It's generally a typical Chinese restaurant. They serve the usual chow mein, fried rice, dinner specials for groups, etc. I cane here for the Korean Chicken Wings though.

I got the combination rice plate w/ a soup, fried rice, korean chicken wings, & the potstickers.

Verdict:

- Fried Rice: Ok. I was hungry so I devoured it. Nothing special.

- Potstickers: Not the best I've had. 

- Korean Wings: Crispy but sauce was a little too sweet and had a tartness in the background. I still like San Tung's version. 

-------------------------------------------------

Overall my experience wasn't worth raving about. Glad I tried it but I would rather go to San Tung for my chicken needs. But if I was in the area...I'd try the other stuff like chow mein & walnut prawns. Prices are relatively low so that's a plus at least.
author: Ralph N.

description: It's cheap it's delicious and I love it. Their combo is a total steal. Never been disappointed. Szechuan for days.
author: Brady S.

description:
Who would have known such a great Chinese restaurant would be located here.

It's not the most authentic, but it's more authentic than most. +1 for that. 

The portions are big for the price. +1 for that. 

It's not the best tasting asian food, but for the price range, it's solid. Some chinese restaurants are westernized. Some chinese restaurants are chinese. This place tastes halfway in between. 

At any rate, I'm thankful this place exists in the Mission.
author: Tuan V.

description: Great place for a large group. Good service, good food, friendly staff. We went here before going to the movies in the Mission. Highly recommended.
author: Jack L.

description: Mmmm mmm great food! Make sure to get the chicken wings! Chicken wings are better than san tung's and there is no wait! The owner puts in a lot of work into the food and service to make customers happy!
author: Fahmida F.

description: Good Chinese food but the fried rice is not so good. The combo fried rice has no eggs in it and the shrimp are very small. The fried chicken wings in the spicy sauce and the beef and rice noodle dish is good. The shrimp wonton soup rules.
author: Anthony L.

description: Been coming here for over 12 years. The best sweet and sour chicken I've had ! I always get the chow mein sweet and sour chicken and potstickers. Delicious !
author: Irma B.

description:
The food is ok. 1950s style Chinese-American greasy spoon.

Service average. A bit overpriced vs portion size.

No way does this deserve 4 stars.
author: superdave x.

description:
This is another example of how Yelp needs weight classes for ratings.  My four stars for this neighborhood Chinese place aren't the same as four stars I'd give to, say, a Michael Mina place or something of that nature.

That said, this is a pretty good, reliable, neighborhood Chinese place--greasy, salty, all that.  If you're looking for innovative cuisine, move on.  This place is all about tried and true.  The Korean wings are as good as advertised, though not very spicy (maybe they toned them down for the white guy?).  Spring rolls and chow mein were also tasty, but definitely not light on the oil or salt.

Good spot for locals to get take out, probably not that much of a destination I'd travel to.
author: Ken V.

description: Favorite Chinese food  in the city hands down! Nice staff, fast service, and bomb food. Get their attention and sit where you like. Their house is tea is good. I always start with the won ton soup, soooo good.
author: Yanely Z.

description: The food here is legit!  Hole in the wall in an area that is getting gentrified quickly.  Not sure how much longer this place will be around but I am going to keep going while it is.  Order the korean chicken wings and the fried rice you won't regret it.  I'm salivating just thinking about it.
author: Helen Y.

description: I have no idea what those other yelpers are talking about.  They have never steered me so wrong.  Sweet and sour chicken- gross.  Korean chicken - thought it would be grilled.  Asked for it spicy.  It was basically a deep friend wings in a very sweet sauce.  Their fried rice was bland.  It wasn't just okay - it was straight up bad.
author: Madhuri K.

description: This is one most likely one of the few casual dining / fast food Asian Restaurants in San Francisco where they cook so good.
author: Antoine W.

description:
Wow this place is so cheap and food is actually not that bad. They were closed but luckily I had ordered the food over the phone. 
If I am around Misson District I know where to go for good and cheap lunch.
author: Bimarsh S.

description: Came to this restaurant for over 35 years ago and still the same. Good food at a great price. Lunch and dinner you can't go wrong. Portions are large and authentic Chinese style cooking as possible in the Mission.
author: LL Y.

description:
Best Korean chicken I've ever tasted. I waited for an hour & 30 
minutes because they close from 3:00-4:00 pm monday thru thursday. It would of been nice if they would say that on their web page & yelp.
author: Nancy R.

description: The food here is decent enough, I suppose.  However, the service is beyond ridiculous. I placed an order and it was delivered without one of the dishes I purchased.  I called the restaurant and they admitted the error and said they would have the dish made and delivered right away. After waiting an hour, I called and they said "the delivery guy hasn't come back yet."  After another 45 minutes, I called and they said "Oh the delivery guy never came back and I went ahead and issued you a refund already."  They never called to let me know the order was cancelled. Ruined dinner for my and my guest. What horrible customer service!
author: Patrick L.

description:
Love this china food is soooooo GOOD! I could eat it everyday if I can lol ! Customer service is a PLUSSSS 
The orders are always in order, and let you sit anywhere once you waiting for your food to come! Plus the spicy chile is the BOMB!!!!!!
author: Xochitl F.

description:
The food is great with hefty portions. I've been here three times. And the location is away from busy Mission Street. 

First visit with a co-worker who is also a regular and told me about here: "Spicy Korean boneless Chicken ($7.75) with a side of rice, please!"

Second visit (translation in Cantonese): "Lat Hon Jyu gaai, tung mai yat dip baak faan!

Third visit (translation in Spanish): "Pollo Coreano Con un Cuenco de arroz!"

The chicken pieces are battered up crispy and dip in a glazed spicy Korean sauce. "This dish is better than what you get at Panda Express!"

In any language, this is my favorite dish from the restaurant.
author: Matt G.

description: Do yourself a favor and not come here. The food is disgusting. I ate not ever a quarter of my chow mein because... it was just not food. Don't come ere.
author: Peter N.

description:
Great food and very friendly service.
Did I mention cheap and huge portions? It's a nice spot for a relaxed lunch.
Great for big groups as they have those tables with middle rolling top.
I'm coming back with friends next time.
author: Maggie J.

description: Been going to this Chinese spot in the mission since i can remember with my grandma. It seems kind of unusual to have been here for so long given the area. Im glad they are still operational because its one of the better Chinese spots in san fran. always order the soup when dining in, i prefer beef won ton soup. the Korean chicken is also superb, you can get boneless or bone in, they have different flavors but both are really good. the portions are generous and the quality is good. If your a fan of the korean chicken, and can afford it, they also have korean shrimp.
author: Alex R.

description: Since I currently live in Los Angeles I often crave delicious Chinese food. (Los Angeles doesn't have many amazing options unless you want to take an hour drive). I decided to trust help and ventured into the mission district with my Chinese food craving. I'm very happy yelp directed me to this restaurant. The venue was large and my group and I were seated by the windows at a round table. The staff was efficient and brought our orders out in a timely manner. Everything tasted excellent. We ordered the salty fish fried rice, broccoli beef, cashew chicken, cashew nut prawns, chicken chow mien and a couple other items that I can't recall. It was all very good and our bill came out to $14 each (including tax and tip) which was fantastic. I recommend trying this spot if you are in the area. I probably wouldn't go out of my way to dine here but if already in the area then I wouldn't hesitate.
author: Kristy F.

description:
We found this place quite by accident when we were in SF and looking for an early lunch. Based on the reviews we decided to give it a go.

In a nutshell, if you are super hungry and need a huge amount of food, this place will not disappoint. I couldn't believe how much food we got for about $8 each. 

We had the special for 3 with pot stickers (4), hot & sour soup (huge bowl - filled 6 smaller cups), fried rice (giant mound), chicken with mixed veggies and Mongolian beef.

The food was good, about average for these dishes. We had so much leftover that we took home enough for another meal. Everything seemed seasoned with soy sauce and was very brown in color. The ingredients seemed to be of good quality. 

If we go again, I'd make sure and getting something that wasn't brown.
author: Song H.

description:
The struggle of finding a good go-to Chinese restaurant that actually has decent, if not delicious, and cheap food is near impossible.. Until I found this place.

I used to attend City college near Bartlett street and there was this little Chinese hole-in-the wall that I would always pass by when getting breakfast at the Crepe House. To this day, I never understood why I never checked it out. I have honestly passed this restaurant for years, picking up my little brother and such. One day I finally have it a shot and I wish I remembered the date because oh my goodness.. Lets just say every time I pass by it now, I always want to go in! 

I'm very picky and I like to go to certain places to eat certain things. I haven't eaten much on their menu but I absolutely love the beef fried rice and beef chow mein. The fried rice was usually my regular and one of the employees know how I like it spicy. Now thats a plus - a man who remembers what you tell them; Ha! 

This is now one of my favorite places. And may I add that it's close to home. :)
author: Sadia B.

description:
GET THE KOREAN CHICKEN. it's bomb. other stuff i've ordered here wasn't the best and i could probably do without. sweet and sour soup is just okay, the dumplings aren't good, and the chow mein isn't great either. 

however, the food is really cheap and again, the korean chicken is SO GOOD (but will definitely give you a food coma afterwards)
author: Amanda L.

description:
I really have no idea why this restaurant is rated so highly. First of all, the pitcher of water that was given to us was extremely filthy. We had to ask for bottled water. Their service is poor, no one asked us if we enjoyed our food or needed anything else. We ordered plenty of dishes and none of them edible. They all had some weird oil taste to it and the orange chicken we ordered was so hard from the inside that we lost our appetites. 

The worst part is how they added service fee on their own when we were even really provided with much of it.
author: Ashaba C.

description: Great wings! Good service. Food came extremely fast. Will come all the time! Can't find better Chinese food in the mission district. Waiter was also really friendly. 5/5
author: Jason W.

description: I love this place! Been coming here since I was a baby (im 20 now). Miss Mama tho, wish she was there more often. This place never fails, i dont live in the city anymore but whenever theres a chance, my mom and i come here. Best plates are the Beef Wonton Soup, Chicken Chow Mein, and the Korean Shrimp ...seriously, I DONT EAT SEAFOOD ...BUT I LOVE THEIR KOREAN SHRIMP!!!!! Love this place, im glad that after all these years theyre still in business!
author: Jackie R.

description: After reading all the reviews yesterday me and the family were expecting really good food? Went with the Korean chicken chefs special beef chowmein and fried rice, the food was Sub par! I don't understand what all these great reviews were coming from? Expected a lot better after reading all the reviews!!
author: David G.

description:
Came here as part of our short food tour within the Mission district.  All we got was some hot n sour soup and the chicken wings.  Now, keep in mind, we had the famous wings from San Tung the night before so our memories of those delectable wings were fresh in our minds. 

The wings did not disappoint.  It was a slightly different flavor, but the wings were still great!  Sauce was nice and sweet, chicken was crispy and moist, and best of all, it was pretty cheap!  

The soup was pretty good.  I don't remember it being anything special or having any distinct difference from other hot and sour soups I've had.  

I would definitely come back here to try more of the food.  As we were walking out, the honey walnut shrimp on another table looked great!
author: Sennett L.

description: this place is an old time favorite love being here don't be turned away by the decor that's a distraction come in  and enjoy well made food for reasonable prices and please don't forget the Korean chicken because this resturant makes it the best ........... happy dinning
author: Melanie L.

description: Paper sign in front window states closed from 3p-4:30p mon-thurs. super disappointed but still love this place
author: Michael M.

description: I only ordered soup --  Wor won ton soup. Weak broth, skimpy ingredients, old left over pieces of fatty pork, pre-cooked chicken mystery nuggets, together with mushrooms from a can and water chestnuts from a can made for a miserable soup experience.  These folks may do something well, but wor won ton soup isn't it.
author: Marvin N.

description:
It was...meh...just ok.
Didn't care for the hot and sour soup...too salty and bland.
The Kung Pao Chicken was overly salty and a bit bland as well.
I've had much better.
author: Jose G.

description: This place is good!!! There are lots of Chinese restaurants in the city, we came here as a second option when my bookmarked place was closed for vacation. It doesn't look like much that's for certain. But it was very busy so it was a good sign. It was $28 or so for three of us to eat with plenty of leftovers we actually had to give to a homeless person because we weren't going home. Food was very good in quality and flavor. I could tell what kind of meat I was eating, which is very hard to come by in Chinese cuisine. I was kind of disappointed that on the combo plates for one they don't let you do half rice half chow mein, but my friend and I just gave each other a little bit of each. The Szechuan shrimp was sooooo good, I loved the flavor of the sauce, the batter made the shrimp a little soggy but it was still good shrimp. I wasn't a huge fan of the Mongolian beef, it was very salty and missing somewhat sweet flavor that I actually found in the Szechuan sauce so I took a scoop of my friends plate and mixed it with my Mongolian beef. I would definitely recommend this place to friends near by, and I would come back as well.
author: Miranda H.

description:
THE BEST OF THE BEST 
I loveeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee this place :)
My fav dish: Korean chicken (Obviously), and Chow Mein !!
Korean Chicken is MUST ! 
+ They recently added new spicy chicken on their menu. I haven't had time to try it, but I assume it is going to be awsome !
author: Yumi K.

description:
I'm incredibly grateful for this find.

If San Tung is 10/10 quality, this place is 9/10 and much cheaper and closer to me. There was no wait and service was incredibly quick.

I made 3 orders of the Korean Fried Chicken, and made some rice and salad at home. This was enough to make 6 people incredibly full, so the portions here are great.

Definitely coming back to this place, and will most likely order to-go again because the place itself is a bit too dark for me to feel happy eating one hell of a great meal. LOL. but seriously, it's delicious.
author: Vi T.

description: Solid Chinese food with dinner combos for under $9. I really like the Korean chicken with fried rice. Eaten here three times and haven't ordered a thing I didn't enjoy. It's a bit of a dive and you're not paying for ambience, but they do accept credit cards (a rare thing in the mission).  Certainly a great place to order take out to hit the spot when you're craving fast Chinese food. I recommend and would eat here again.
author: Tony B.

description: I had the mixed vegetable (thick) chow mien, and it was below average. The staff wasn't rude but definitely wasn't polite either. The women at the cashier just seemed as if she didn't care about the customers. I wasn't greeted in the first place. And when I said I was looking for some vegetarian dishes, she simply threw a menu on the counter. And by threw, I meant threw. The chow mien was way too oily and tasteless. Not even worth the $7. I'm not sure where all these good reviews came from.
author: Meiyi C.

description:
Looking for greasy better than Panda Express Chinese food?!  Heunh Yuen is the place!  They have family style dishes and combo meals!  Perfect luncheon, huge portions, and tons of options!  I got the Lunch Combo C:  2 potstickers or 2 egg rolls, choice of any beef, pork, or chicken dish (under 8.25), AND fried rice, chow mein, or steam rice!  Oh don't forget the soup of the day too!  Everything for $8 bucks a person.

I'm so full, but totally satisfied.  WARNING:  You will feel like shit afterwards, but so worth it!  Be prepared for coffee break or some sort of caffeine recharge an hr after eating.  You have been warned!!!
author: Jackie O.

description:
Very good food. We ordered hot and sour soup (I didn't realize there would be enough for four or more), dumplings, Korean chicken (amazing chicken wings), Mongolian beef, and beef pan fried noodles. 
All of it was amazing and came in huge servings! And super cheap for the amount of food
Service was sub-par.
author: Carrie N.

description:
Oh man... go. Right now.

Korean wings are amazing, the fried rice is PERFECT, and pot stickers are to die for. Add a super friendly staff, good prices and fast preparation and you've got five stars all day long.
author: Daniel W.

description:
YES! They finally accept card! (ok yeah, I'm several months late, whatever)

This is the spot for the best potstickers in all SF. Huge portions of really good food for very cheap! I always pass by when I'm in the area.
author: Sophia G.

description: the korean chicken is soo good!!! why go all the way to san tung when this is in the mission?! plus, the chicken wings here are way bigger than san tung. we always order take out- korean fried chicken and the special fried rice. portion size is great.
author: Sarina A.

description:
(+): the crispiness of the korean wings

(-): the korean wings were too sweet and had too much sauce. the chicken quality was OK. tbh this seemed like a san tung rip off. also the place was kind of gross.

(0): not really sure how it gets such high reviews.
author: Siva M.

description: This is by far the best Chinese food in the Bay Area. The Korean wings are delicious you can order them spicy not spicy even boneless for a great price. My favorite chowmein is the chefs special. The wonton soup is great also and let's not even mention the fried rice to die for! I love this place but the parking is pretty difficult in the area bc there's only street parking and I wish they would open Sundays. If you are ever in SF stop by you won't regret it. It may not be the fanciest place but it's really humble, delicious, and the staff is ver friendly. You will not regret it!
author: Stacy G.

description: Its very good here, had the $5.50 dinner special, bean cake beef over rice. You cant get much more rice plate than that. the waitress even boxed the neighboring tables food.
author: Kevin L.

description: Simple and tasty Chinese food. Friendly staff. Table service, but far from white tablecloth dining. Very good value, especially at lunch.
author: Shane R.

description:
Simple and sweet food of my people.

As a descendant of a family that owned and ran its own Chinese American restaurant, places like Heung Yuen hold a special place in my heart.  This restaurant has potential with its large tables to accommodate big groups and Chinese families, but every time I go here, the restaurant is below its capacity. The food and decor is simply not trendy enough for the Valencia St crowd and that's okay.  We gotta have some budget food options in this expensive city!

The Korean fried chicken has me coming back here again and again.  Compared to San Tung's wings, these are larger and err more on the sweeter side.  Compared to SO's chicken wings, Heung Yuen's definitely tone down the spice (I prefer the sweet).  

Once this dish has me through the door, I just blindly pick supporting items: an order of house special chow mein or beef chow fun, broccoli beef, egg flower soup, kung pao tofu...whatever I'm feeling that day.  They are all accompaniments for the main attraction (those wings tho)!! 

Service is speedy.  Menus are tri-lingual (English, Spanish, and Chinese).  And like I said, their prices won't break the bank.
author: Kathleen W.

description: Best hole in the wall Chinese restaurant in all of SF in my opinion. My parents have been going here way before they were even married and they've been married for 27 going on 28 years. So needless to say I've been going here since I can remember and I'm 26 going on 27. The Korean chicken is the best and they have amazing sizzling rice soup, fried rice, and chow mein! They're extremely inexpensive but delicious food. I go here so often that they remember my usual! I love love love it here that I always have to bring visitors here and anyone that loves amazing Chinese food
author: Heather S.

description: I luv this place, they are always friendly.  The Korean Prawns are the best thing on the menu hands down
author: Tiffany T.

description: Some of the best Chinese food I've had in the city. Don't miss out on their fried rice.
author: Dan P.

description:
Took me a couple months of walking by to enter, but once I did, it was love at first bite. 

The wonton soup in incredible. I don't have a go to dish. The menu is huge. Everything I have tried has been delicious... although after reading other reviews I guess I have been missing out on the Korean Chicken!

Great value, friendly service, five stars. I'll be back - often.
author: Margo S.

description: Absolutely greatest Korean Chinese food in the Bay Area. The Korean chicken is to die for. It's in the heart of the Mission same recipe as they did in the 80s.
author: Eddy J.

description: Hits the spot every time. I've been eating the Korean chicken from here ever since I've been old enough to eat. Haha. My dad used to come pick it up after school for us way back in the day when it was $5 flat for the same size order. Not only does the food hold many memories for me but it's just sooo good. I have yet to find another place that serves Korean chicken like they do. They're fried rice is great to. So what it looks like the kinda place that's been around 25+ years. With all the gentrification going on in that area and the places on Valencia st-it's nice having this spot as an anchor. The good ole feeling of "some things will never change" (including the f*** you service that comes along with going anywhere with my pops lol)
author: Jessica L.

description:
KOREAN CHICKEN WINGS FTW (if you are sick of Mission Chinese or don't want to wait in the long ass lines of San Tung) I recommend their sweet finger licking good chicken wings.

Also their combo wonton soup is cheap, tasty, and great for the winter time (helped me with my cold)
author: Shirley L.

description: If you want authentic chinease food you should visit this place, it is delicious. I have been eating at this place for years and I am not bored with the food, atmosphere, and the staff. If you go you should try their shrimp won ton soup it is one of the best soups I have ever had in my entire life. Hopefully you enjoy this place like I do.
author: Saul E.

description: do not eat here!!!!!!!!! my wife brought me a order of fried rice home. she works down the street and has been there many times. she swears this place is off the hook. so i took my fried rice to work the next day and when i was almost done with it. i happend to look down in the box. and what did i find? i big ass dead fly!!!!!!!!!! i have never been so disgusted in my life. now not only did it make me not want to eat there anymore. it made me not even want rice anymore. i really wished i had taken a picture so everybody can see. i will never recommend this place to anybody!!!!! please do not give them any money. this is not a 4 star place. not a very happy customer!!!!!!
author: Matthew M.

description: I was pleasantly surprised with this place! I had never been to San Francisco. We realized we were on the edge of Chinatown and were wanting lunch so I searched best cheap food in Chinatown San Francisco and came up with this place. A party was coming out as we were going in and they asked if we had ever eaten there and when we said no they started going off about how it was the best food. They were right, it was fantastic. It is a hole in the wall, no thrills, restaurant with good portions and cheap prices. The t
author: Nikki Lee D.

description: There are so many things not to recommend this restaurant--they occasionally mess up phone orders, the atmosphere is entirely lacking, the non-Korean Chicken items I've ordered have been unimpressive, and they don't even have takeout menus.  But in spite of all those things, the Korean Chicken totally and thoroughly carries the day.  Ask for it extra spicy (which still isn't that spicy).  It's one of the best dishes you can get in the Mission, and I say that thoroughly respecting the heavy competition that's around.
author: Victoria P.

description: Even though I spent some of my best childhood years growing up in the "Mission District" (us prehistoric originals never call it in Google hipsterese "I'm so cool I live in "The Mission,") I usually avoid eating in the neighborhood I grew up in, thinking of it as kind of the SF version of "The Occupied West Bank" and my original Latino Homiez and their families as the Frisco version of The Palestinians, driven out of their homes by new settlers who claim that the new Google gods gave them the right. But I was invited to have lunch there by an old neighborhood friend who said that he has been eating here at Heung Yuen for 30 years, since he was 2. I should have known better, especially since he's 32 and can hardly walk already, and his right leg is permanently asleep due to poor circulation. But I wanted to see him, so here I was, feeling like I was walking through "occupied Hebron" in "hipster territory" heehee, amid the new "invisible checkpoints," the $100 bistro tabs, designed to keep the original locals out, and among all the $20 coffee "boutiques" and Birkenstock wearing "loungers," acting like they owned these streets, the hallowed grounds where "Los Siete De La Raza roamed" (Google it for more info haha, Google again, such irony,) and the 24th St Boyz held sway, finding my way to Heung Yuen. I sighed when I saw that this place truly hasn't changed from the outside, (and inside) since my childhood, but now, oddly out of place amid the slick themed bistros and bars around it. So anyway, I seldom talk about "health" in these reviews because the assumption is that if my butt is in that chair, it ain't gonna kill me (or you.) But this time I have to  seriously consider my own (and your) mortality when I talk about Heung Yuen, and especially that often reviewed  "sent from heaven" conqueror of the yelp universe, superhero "Korean" chicken. Which btw, truthfully is not really "Korean" or associated with real "Korean chicken"'in any way shape or form. Those of you that are Korean (from The Big K,) or second generation, and know about this, or If you're under 30 and don't know, ask your parents about "Pelicana Chicken," in Korea, the original, who pioneered and commercialized this type, (deep fried glazed,) the template, the "real" no lie, and always the best, and you will know that Heung Yuen's (although yes, crunchy on the outside and yes tender inside,) version's flavors are off, no balance between hot and spicy. An amateur overly sweet snd gratuitously unhealthy, wanna be knock off. A Cantonese cooks mistaken impression of what Korean chicken "must be like." So seriously my hipster settler heroes. Since you put so much money and effort into driving my Latino homiez and their families out of their Mission District homes, and changed its character with your google salaries, then maybe you should start saving some artery space from now on so you can enjoy it, by avoiding this place. So I'm not gonna run with the pack on this one. Two stars max for cheap prices. POSTSCRIPT: After lunch there, I sat on "the throne" all afternoon and into the evening and night, and no I ain't the dang Last Emperor. Haha, very funny.  I swear I can tell the noodles in our bland, greasy tomato beef chow mein, were fried in lard. Yes, I can tell the diff. Cuz I'm the noodle (and sushi) king, no lie. "Noodle G"?" Nah that sounds kinda stupid. Anyway, truthfully, after eating here, my toes and fingers were numb (bad circulation) till the next day. So, if you're a twenty something, you ain't gonna be listenin to me about what you put in your body past your tastebuds anyway. But if you're around 40, then you'll know after the first few bites, that you ain't got no biz eatin this stuff, and putting your body through this, unless your BFF works in the ER and your second BFF is a paramedic to get you there. (Just think of your spouse and kids, and you'll be outta here and on the 48 back to The Sunset in a minute.)
author: George F.

description: Big turn off as I was waiting to order.  One of the sous chefs cut open what looked to be a bag of sea food and put his nose right up on it and sniffed several times.  Must have been rotten and freezer burnt.  I'll pass.
author: Ann M.

description: Food is always awesome, fresh, and well seasoned. The staff have great personalities, and they are very helpful and the service is fast. I would recommended this restaurant to anyone that loves good food.
author: Charmi M.

description: My mom would bring my two sisters and me to this restaurant every sunday after church when we where little.  30 years later, we all have moved to live in the East Bay but every chance we get we go back to this restaurant.  Our All time Favorite is the Korean Chicken.. Haven't found any other restaurant that can make them like they do.  We also love there Won ton soup, Broccoli Beef, Sweet and Sour, ect.. ect..  Now, we have had the chance to bring our kids to this restaurant and tell them the story of how excited we would get every sunday cause sadly yes (we didn't like going to church.. really bad I know), we didn't mind because our mom would treat us to this place.  I am so happy to be able to be able to leave this feedback for this restaurant.  I am so Happy to see that they are still going strong and we love seeing that there are still a couple of workers still there after 30 years.
author: SD D.

description:
I was near by at the WIX Lounge doing some work, and needed lunch. Having not to settle for fast food, or fried chicken, I looked up Chinese food and Heung Yuen was only a block away from the USBank building. Upon arrival, I still had to wait an additional 20 minutes for my food, after calling in for pick-up, and purposely walking-slow along 22nd St. Are you kidding me?! Although, it was affordable, I didn't like the style of service of an open kitchen door open for guest at the dining area to see. 

(A personal preference of mine - I don't like seeing my food prepared. Especially at hole-in-the wall places like these.) 

I sat down, and waited for my food. Checked in on Foursquare, checked my Twitter, and Facebook - and still no food. I seriously bet, they didn't start making my order until I arrived. -___- 

Although the uncomfortable wait, the food was delicious, like any other Chinese place. I was super hungry -  and everything I ordered was perfect. Nothing new. But satisfying enough..
author: Tiffany M.

description: Ive been going to this place since I was 9 years old. My first day in San Framcisco; this was my first dining place. I would recommend their beef won ton soup and beef stew.  To those complaining about their "non" Korean Chicken, you obviously have poor taste since everyone else seem to pick this particular dish as favorite.  If you have no taste for Asian food you should just stick to your usual American food..... #justsayin
author: Michael L.

description:
1) Spicy Korean Chicken is the best 
2) Good price
3) Nice, Friendly & Informative Staff
4) They clean their place. 

What more can one ask for?
author: Juila L.

description:
This rarely happens but Yelp you failed me last night. Wanted to venture out of my comfort zone (aka The Sunset) and try something in the Mission. The staggering drunk guy outside Heung Yuen should have been the tell-tale sign to turn around and leave. But despite my first ominous sign, we continued. We were seated next to a table of young foul mouth teens (yes, I've turned into a grumpy old man) and this one girl would not stop swearing... every other word was something harsh and terrible - f-bombs, N-bombs, etc. So that's strike two, if you're keeping count. 

Onto the food. Ordered: Korean chicken (boneless), string beans with beef, salt & pepper pork chop, mango shrimp, and seafood pan fried noodle. The food was eh.... definitely had better. Portions were good and the prices were definitely wallet-friendly. 

Their service had mixed reactions. Overall great but at the end of the meal one of the servers started clearing people's plates even though some of us were clearly still eating. I was getting livid but held my tongue cuz I know once I go off, I go off! Granted I think he was clearing the table so that we can cut the birthday cake we'd brought. But by that time we were just ready to leave this place behind us. 

I can see the appeal to this divey Chinese restaurant. It's low-down-dirty-Tuesday-night-I-don't-feel-like-cooking-I'm-ordering-Chinese-take-out kinda place. It's really a quick stop for the locals. And that's where I'm leaving it at... for the locals!
author: Stephen Y.

description:
I like to think that as a young child, my love for fried chicken started here. No lie. With my parents' house less than a block away, my mom would take me and my brother here after elementary school and what do I remember vividly? A plate of their Korean fried chicken.

For whatever reason we stopped our visits (though not because the food was bad). 
Whenever I would walk by I would wonder if everything was as good as I remembered. It must have been, because it has been open for at least the past 20 years. 

Well I finally got around to seeing if it still lived up to my childhood hype. Need my five stars say any more? The wings are just as good if not better than I remember. We also ordered chow mein, egg rolls, and beef and broccoli. The bill came out to less than $30. Good prices. Even better food. I'm coming back, and this time I won't wait as long to return.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
SANITATION ISSUES

Dirty is probably the right word.  They served me chopsticks that were so greasy and sticky that I had to go to the restroom to wash my hands after I touched them.  In spite of that, I did try some of the food, and it tasted okay.
author: John S.

description:
Service is great as well as the chicken wings. 

Lunch special is drenched in heavy oil which I think may be MSG
author: Isis L.

description: YUM! This hole in the wall Chinese restaurant has quickly become the regular go to spot for my roommate and I. The combos are the way to go, so much yummy food for under $8! The sesame chicken is my personal favorite, I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. Great food. Huge Menu. Fast service. Clean. Friendly staff. Great prices. Can't beat it! Definitely the best neighborhood Chinese joint. I highly recommend it!
author: Melanie K.

description: My roommate and I were on the hunt for a good Chinese place near our apartment. We did take out a number of times from places that were really disappointing. Then we found this place and decided to just go in and that my friends, was an excellent decision. It's quick, it's fresh, it's delicious and it's cheap! The kitchen is open to the restaurant, which I really like, so you can watch the chefs. They have a good combo deal that gets you a full plate of food (meat dish, rice, egg roll or pot stickets) for under $8. Service is friendly and fast. Menu is extensive. I usually stick to the sesame chicken because it is fantastic. It's a great neighborhood find, I highly recommend it!
author: Mandy A.

description: I've been coming here since I was a child when my grandfather owned a dry cleaners up the street. The food has been consistently good and the service is very friendly. I no longer live on San Francisco but whenever I'm in the area I stop in for great Chinese food. Everything on the menu is great but by far the Korean Chicken is my favorite!! Nice and crispy with just the right amount of spice; eat them while hot! If you're looking for flashy ambiance this is not the spot for you but if you like good authentic Chinese food this place comes highly recommended. Enjoy!
author: M. Naima W.

description:
My husband and I have been coming here since we were pre-school aged - that's insane, right?! And the same litte old lady works there - and she hasn't aged a bit! With every visit, she greets us...

"Hi how you? Where you mom? They got lotta kids!" She's hilarious. I love her.

So about the food...sigh. After my hundreds upon hundreds of visits, I can admit that their food is hit-or-miss. Some dishes are fantastic and others are a flop. But I eat there partially because I feel an alliance to the old lady, and partially because my husband refuses to eat Chinese food anywhere else.

What you must try:
Korean chicken - AMAZING. Crispy, honey crust on the outside, tender juicy meat inside.
Potstickers - they are still my favorites after all these years
Wor won ton

Skip:
Rice or chow mein - it's overfried and lacking in flavor. What a huge disappointment.

The food arrives suspiciously fast after you order, and the bill for two is generally under $30, and we have plenty of leftovers. If you order right, this place can be a true gem.
author: Mariela D.

description: Koren Chicken, yes please!! Friends turned me to this place and I'm feeling it. Haven't tired anything I don't like!
author: Patricia G.

description:
Tired of tacos...I asked around the office for lunch ideas. Since I was in the mood for won ton soup, this place was recommended.

It is easy to find on foot. Very basic layout inside. Many tables no frills decoration. Service was quick. Beef wonton soup and mixed meat clay pot were perfect. Splashed a generous amount of hot sauce on those bad boys, made my day. Portions are very generous and had me some leftovers for later.
author: Hilda Z.

description: Great for takeout! Service is usually very fast and the prices are reasonable. The mongolian beef with rice is very tasty and a huge portion, easily enough for 2 meals. The restaurant isn't fancy, but it is definitely good.
author: Julia C.

description: All I gotta say is try the CHEF'SPECIAL CHOW MEIN!!! OMG it is Sooo delicious and also the Mongolian Beef and OMG THE BEEF WON TON SOUP!! This is the best Chinese food I've tried in SF AND IVE YET TO TASTE BETTER CHOW MEIN, Mongolian beef and won ton soup!! You will not regret it!!!
author: Carina M.

description: The balance between quality and price is excellent. I just relocated from the Far East and know how the great Chinese dishes look like. We tried a dinner combo and was too good and too much for two people to finish them up. Note: this is for family or friends; not for datings...
author: Johnny O.

description:
$5.50 for a big place of chicken chow main, rice and fried Wongton can't go wrong with that! 
Friendly, cheap and good!!
author: Silvia R.

description: Best Chinese food in the mission hands down. Been coming here since i was a kid. Korean shrimp and chow mein are great!! Great prices and daily specials also.
author: J R.

description: This place has been around forever.  I use to come here when I was a baby and now im mid 30's.  Still the best chinese food ever.  Korean Chicken ! Wow ! Make it spicy!!!
author: Joe B.

description: I challenge you to find a bigger bang for your buck in the Mission than Heung Yuen. Then when you find that utterly ginormous bang, I will challenge you again to find cheap greasy American Chinese food that doesn't leave you hating yourself. And if you find that? Well, then I will probably send you on a wild goose chase to find a restaurant who can provide the highly efficient and friendly service of Heung Yuen. You're sure not gonna find it.
author: Keito U.

description:
Tried this spot for the 1st time tuh-DAY! Hands down, there Korean Chicken is the best wings in the City! It's all in the sauce. Seriously, I was dancin' in my seat and when I'm dancin' in my seat that means you dance with me cuz the food is scrumpdiliumpcious! Lol. 
     It was a busy time of the day but we were served pretty quick and we were not the only group of 10 there. Of course, being a Samoan group, we had Family style servings times 10. We shared:

-Shrimp Chow Mein

-Chicken Chow Mein

- 2 dishes of Korean Chicken (salivatin' right now)

-Pork Fried Rice

It was a lovely day in the City aaaaand I'm crossin' the Bay just to dine here again.
author: Aaron F.

description: After reading the reviews, I had great expectations for this place. The food was good, but not like anything I've read here. I got the Korean chicken special with the wonton soup, chow mein, and pot stickers. Everything was average and nothing really stood out to me as amazing. Price was the best part of this restaurant, but the food is nothing to write home about, and I wouldn't actively seek to return.
author: Orlando A.

description: The best in mission neighborhood..... they always give a good enough portion of food love thier service
author: Karen M.

description:
This is an old-school Cantonese dive. I've never seen it more than half full in here, but they always seem to be heavy on the staff. Looking in the open kitchen, there are always at least 5 to 6 people prepping or cooking. I think they get a lot of take out orders.

The Korean chicken wings are the only reason I come here. And I get them to go, where I munch on them with some rice and some steamed veggies. The wings are deep fried and very crispy, then tossed in a sweet, salty, spicy, sticky goo. The sauce could be a bit spicier, but since a healthy order of ~8 to 10 wing joints costs under $8, I can't complain.

They also have clay pot dishes, which I one day hope to try.
author: J K.

description: Hands down one of the best Chinese places ever their Korean chicken and potstickers are smacking and I love their oyster sauce chicken or beef their wor won ton soup is also on point been going here since I was born and my parents came here way before they even met I'm 29 so that's a very long time def recommend this spot.
author: Jonathan M.

description: This is THE best Chinese food in the mission...hands down! From the staff to the owner, great service. The restaurant has a down to earth feel, pre-yuppy era. Now let's get to the food. All dishes are good and reasonably priced, but there are some great dishes, one in particular, the Korean chicken. I have never had the boneless, so I can not comment on that but the Korean chicken with bone is simply amazing.
author: Adrian P.

description:
This place it alright. I live like 2 blocks away, and when I want somethiing else than Tacos/Burritos.  Cheesteaks/Hamburgers. Pizza/McDonalds. (yeah alot of food around me) I'll hit this spot up. For the price they give you a pretty big serving. I usually take my grub to go. And a Chicken Fried Rice can easily feed 3 people.
The Chicken, and beef plates are pretty good too. I usually just get the Korean Chicken though.They're service is pretty quick too.
author: Eric N.

description: What can I say...this place really satisfies my greasy chinese food craving.  Gotta try their korean chicken..its good.
author: Marcus D.

description:
Today I went this place around 5pm and ordered Chef special fish with $10.99 to take out.
When I opened the container, I was shocked to see the batter pieces of fish with sauce only filled with 1/5 of the container.  It didnot make sense to me with $12 I paid totally.   I finished it in 1 minute, but didn't feel eat anything at all.  The sauce on fish was not good either.     I had been this restaurant few times 3 years ago.     The quality is not better , but the quantity certainly became worse.    With $12 spent, I didn't feel I have eaten anything.    What a horrible experience!  I am glad I didn't eat in restaurant to pay any tip for such expensive dishonest business. 
Never never come back!
author: Grace C.

description:
There is a part of me that shuns fast food but at the same time craves Chinese takeout. It's an interesting contrast indeed. It's not just Chinese food I search for in the middle of the night like a Mr. Chow's or dim sum or Hong Kong BBQ but I'm talking about the run down shack with neon lights that simply read, "TAKEOUT" or "CHOW MEIN." I've never had chow mein till about 2 weeks ago by the way and the experience was like the first time I ever had mac and cheese. 

This particular restaurant was the quintessential example of what I like  in a shack. Red and gold wallpaper, furniture from the 80's, the standard shrine with fruit by the cash register and mispelled specials on the wall galore! I think I've found my new home away from home when I'm in the Mission.

I walked right up the cashier stand, picked out the usual favorites, (Mongolian Beef and Shrimp with Black Bean Sauce) and literally within about 10 minutes time, my food, fortune cookies and change were placed promptly in my hand. These people don't mess around and I like that. The older lady that I'm guessing was the owner or the mom of the owner was kind of testing my knowledge of traditional Chinese food while I waited and I truly found that endearing.

The food was hot, the vegetables crispy and plentiful and the prawns were huge. I was surprised that for the $17 of food I received, it could have honestly served 3 people and then some. I'd definitely come back again for my next Chinese food fix.
author: Jessica K.

description: There's not many hole in the wall Chinese places in the mission, so it's nice to have this place nearby.  They have a pretty big menu of all the real standby items I crave with very reasonable prices.  This is a place I would take my chinese dad and he'd enjoy it more than going to somewhere like R&G because the low prices make the food taste all the better.  The minced beef soup and the korean fried chicken wings, while not like Bonchon's, are both pretty good.
author: Aaron W.

description: REALLY delicious Salted Fish and Chicken fried rice! Def. try the Korean chicken. I usually come here after a stroll in the mission or on Valencia Street. Amazing cook and friendly staff.
author: Sam V.

description: This place is not super modern or fancy, but the staff is always very friendly, the food is pretty good, and the pricing is dirt cheap!  I especially like their chicken with green beans rice plate! for a mere $5.75
author: Steve C.

description: Found this place while craving some Chinese takeout. Definitely authentic with its own unique style and taste. Good service and food came out within 5 minutes time. If your hungry for some Chin Lee can't go wrong here. Must try the fried rice, honey walnut prawns were also uber bomb
author: Brelin P.

description:
One of the best Chinese food spots around. Tiny little hole in the wall type places that is really delicious. 

CASH ONLY

The Korean chicken & Korean shrimp  is one of the best things there.... A must try!!

It's really easy to mess up fried rice... Out of all the Chinese restaurants I've been too they seem to have the best fried rice.
author: Cel Y.

description: Ooo man!!!! I have been coming here ever since before i was planed to become a human bean !!! Thats right my parents were dating when they. Found out about This place!!! And let me just say my mother is past 50!!! Any ways this place is the best!!! You have to get the Korean chicken!! Oo man!! Its so good i cant even explain. Its sweet/crispy/spicy !! Bomb!! Lol
author: Leslie R.

description: ...fried calamari, corn & chicken soup, shrimp and asparagus, and ribs in clay pot...dinner was delicious...
author: Bob L.

description: I love this place friendly service been coming to this place as a kid good chinese food in the mission district
author: Sam G.

description: "One order of Korean chicken to-go please."   $7.87.  I put down $10.  Another guy comes to the counter, takes the $10, "what did you order?" "Korean chicken"  Presto, he hands me the order and my change.  How fast was that!  Faster than McDonald's!  Faster than 7 Eleven!  Why so fast!  Why so crispy and delicious and meaty and fragrant, sweet and slightly kicky.  On top of that, a parking space right in front.  What more can I ask for!
author: Helen L.

description:
After reading many reviews and it seems that their wings are the most popular. I decided to try it. Nice and spicy. Portion was more than enough to have a late night snack. 
On top of that, I ordered the House special fried rice + shrimp and mushroom. You can't go wrong with fried rice! The shrimp and mushroom was a little salty.

They close early.
Price is really cheap.
Tables are really big.
Portion is awesome. 
Kinda reminds me of Chinese fast food.
author: James T.

description: Was in the area with my parents the other day and we were looking for somewhere to eat, so we just happened to stumble upon this place. I was hesitant to go inside because it looked old, run down and ghetto... but when I went inside.. I was surprised to see that it was really clean inside. The owner and the waiters were very joyful and ready to do their job. They have special combos and regular ol Chinese food that you can find at any average Chinese joint. The portions are big and the prices aren't so bad either.
author: Tiff C.

description: We really enjoy this place. It really is your typical Chinese food place though. I prefer the BONELESS Korean chicken - white meat nuggets breaded and glazed. The chowmein is fresh - no noodles stuck together or stale texture and  the staff is always friendly. Ricky ( the smartass waiter sometimes with the pompadour) is especially friendly as had a great sense of humor. Since we always order the same stuff he just asks if we're gonna have the same today. lol The potstickers are good - I really don't eat them from anywhere else (I'm an egg roll guy) but with the vinegar and oil chili mixture which Ricky usually mixes at the table for us makes them very tasty. I'm glad the hipsters go everywhere else because I like this place despite the area
author: Main M.

description: Good wings. Came to look around the Mission district.  Some hot n sour soup and the chicken wings...did i say good wings?.  We got wings from San Tung the night before so any more wings, i'll end up flying.
author: Bruce J.

description: Been here twice, evry time have large portion and tasty meal, recommended for anyone that want big and tasty meal. The price is very cheap.
author: Gooi Z.

description: I tried a few dishes and was underwhelmed with what I had.  After reading so many glittering reviews of the Korean chicken wings, I decided to give them a go - they were ok at best.  They had only the slightest remittance of heat and the flavor was nothing really special.  I also had some chicken chow mien, which was basically  just a few pieces of chicken, two rather large chunks of celery and noodles covered in a sauce I can't really identify.  Having lived a large chunk of my life in China and elsewhere in Asia, I admittedly have very high standards for Chinese food that this place just didn't quite meet.  The staff, however, was very pleasant and filled my order very quickly.  I'm fully open to the possibility that I just visited on an off night, so I may give them another go.
author: Ben N.

description: Been comming here since I was a lil' kid with my mom and it never gets old.. The Korean chicken is the best and next is the fried rice... If u like shrimp the oven baked salted prawn are good.... Can't go wrong for the price here....
author: LUIS L.

description: This place is my favorite Chinese restaurant in the City!  They have been feeding my family for 3 generations.  The staff is very warm and friendly.  As soon as I walk in the door they already know what I'm gonna order: Shrimp Chow Mein no bean sprouts and Korean Chicken extra sauce- a must.  If you say your from San Francisco and especially if you claim the Mission District then you already know what I'm talkin about.  Please support this restaurant.  The food is excellent and quickly prepared, the staff is friendly and I have never been disappointed here.  Everything on the menu is good.  I hope they stay in business forever as now they're my kids favorite Chinese restaurant as well.
author: Lloyd A.

description:
I've been going here since I was a little girl.  I can't believe they still remember me after 30 years!  

All I have to say is KOREAN CHICKEN.  It's sweet, spicy, sticky, deliciousness!  Just order that and you're good to go.  If I'm ever in SF, I ask the hubby if we can make a detour and pick up some childhood memories!
author: Vixen C.

description: Big bowl of delicious noodle soup with pork and perhaps the best spring rolls I've ever had. All for a great price. Nothing fancy, just a classic neighborhood Chinese restaurant. I could tell that most people coming in were regulars, always a good sign.
author: Dayne B.

description: I go here all the time. Korean chicken wings for the win! You have to try it. Service is excellent!
author: Alfonso A.

description:
It's the Mission.  It's not New Chinatown.  So don't expect the best Chinese food around.  What can you expect?  CHEAP.  

My friend and I were in the mood for Chinese but we didn't want to trek all the way to the clement area as we wanted something quick and cheap or as we often call it "quick and dirty."  Well, Heung Yuen definitely satisfied that urge.  Super fast and cheap and the portions are generous.

If only they were open late because this would be an awesome 2am Chinese food place.
author: Karen N.

description: Order the chow mein an Korean Chicken. You will not be disappointed. A family go to spot for 30 years!
author: Kat J.

description: Best Chinese food ever!!!! Best beef won ton soup, and the best ever salt and pepper prawns!!!
author: Blanche E.

description:
Hate to give a low review to a local business, but... yuck!!  Did not like the food here at all.  

Staff was friendly and nice, but I felt the food was greasy and flavorless, and for the quality wasn't even "that cheap."  

Not a fan.
author: Alex J.

description: Great food great price. This time I went in there was a guy with his dog roaming around his the table. Had walk out of the restaurant, I felt repugnant to See wet dog in there. Btw there is a sign by the door that signs NO DOG ALLOWED
author: Greg V.

description:
I hate being indecisive, but its damn near inevitable here. Korean chicken..beef...fish? Damn you Heung Yuen, why must you make me choose? I'd order them all if I could. Actually, I'll admit it, I have ordered them all in one sitting and nope, I don't regret it. Why? Because this place has hands down the best deep-fried dishes (called "Korean chicken/beef/fish"). You can't ever lose with these hot-spicy-sweet-sour-saucy-crispy pieces of deliciousness. I'd bet money on it. 

All the other food is equally amazing, and the service makes everything even better. Its hard to find a place with employees who genuinely care about making customers happy, but Heung Yuen is certainly one of them.
author: Alexander C.

description: Ordered take out from here for the first time tonight. We ordered the garlic green beans, sesame chicken, beef broccoli, chicken won ton soup, and bbq pork fried rice. The won ton soup, sesame chicken, and garlic green beans were amazing. Would definitely recommend. The service was very fast and super friendly. The ambience inside could use a little TLC but that would be my only suggestion and we did take out so i could care less. :)
author: Emma V.

description: Not traditional Chinese food, but pretty damn good and cheap for what it is -- AMC (American Chinese Food). I usually get the combination, which gives you soup of the day (either corn or egg white), fried spring rolls or gyoza, chewy fried rice (that is a good thing!), and a choice of main dish for $10. Everything fried comes out piping hot. The Korean chicken wings are good, but no San Tung.
author: Soysizzle t.

description:
I'm giving Hueng Yuen a whopping 5 stars due solely to their stellar potstickers. This may be the best kept secret in the City. The Proprietress makes them all by hand at the corner table and you can watch her while you eat. 

The filling is delicately spiced chicken and the potstickers are the fried and steamed variety. Crispy crunchy on the bottom, soft on top. A plate or two makes a nice meal. 

I can't vouch for the other meals at Hueng Yuen, but the potstickers alone are worth a detour.
author: Mickey D.

description: This place has always been pretty good except i had one really bad experience there. Undercooked and over seasoned my inedible food. I think they must of just had a terrible day.
author: Bantu Z.

description: MY FAVORITE SPOT!!!! I love the food here. I love the boneless Korean chicken, the Won Ton Soup, Fried Rice, and pot stickers. Just talking about this place makes me want to order some Chinese food... It'll be on my to-do list for today! Too bad they don't deliver lol
author: Deeana ..

description:
It was very cold last night, and I desperately wanted to have Wonton Soup. I don't usually get Chinese Food in Mission because I know what I get. However, I  remembered I haven't tried Wonton Soup at Heung Yuen Restaurant's before. 

I ordered Shrimp Wonton which cost me about $6. Plenty of Wonton, Big Shrimp and little vegetable. I am not sure if they use MSG, but at least I didn't feel thirst after all.

Maybe we can spot few Chinese place between 22nd street to 24th Street and San Jose to Bryant. But you may want to try this place If you want to get quick Chinese food without disappointment. It's Mission, don't hold high hope. This  place doesn't make you regret if you know where you are.
author: Vicki S.

description:
Their Chicken Wings are too sweet for me (although everyone else loves them!)

I think this place is definitely a hidden gem in the Mission though, so for those that are craving mom and pop style chinese food come here. Your wallet will also be safe since this place is not that expensive.

I love that fact that the locals and the people that work there know each other and actually talk, that is simply awesome.
author: Eric A.
