description: The best honey shrimp in the world.  I love watching the little old lady sit at a table in the the corner making potstickers and other goodies!
author: Tony D.

description: love thier food! great tasting been going here for years since i was a little girl! glad thier still open cant wait to go back again :)
author: K A.

description: This place does not deserve a star... It deserves a damn dot...Went here for take out for lunch, mistake!!. Had the Korean wings and combo fried rice.... Wow!!... Really!!. I couldn't  figure out if it was old chicken , old oil, old rice , old shrimp ... Hell!.. I had a bunch of cooked crap for lunch. Where is San Tung's when you need them!
author: deborah w.

description:
Yum! Hole in the wall restaurant in the Mission owned by what seems like a Chinese family. I think the whole family works there - old little grandma works there too. Cute! Looks like a lot of neighborhood regulars frequent this restaurant.

Bf and I ordered the korean chicken, eggplant with garlic sauce, and the salty fish fried rice. TONS of food - huge portions, cheap prices. The chicken was good, a bit on the sweet side, but large succulent pieces of juicy chicken. Eggplant with garlic sauce was good too, and the salty fish fried rice came heaping full on a plate with pungent fish. As it should be!

Great neighborhood place, wish I lived closer!
author: Carol L.

description:
as has probably been mentioned many times before, the order of korean chicken is absolutely delicious and worth trying here. they also have the salted & baked prawns which i eat whole-shell and everything and they are also delicious. you cant go wrong with lunch orders, either, and they're conveniently priced.

edwin the penguin
author: Edwin C.

description: Here AGAIN having my usual - boneless Korean chicken, shrimp chow fun, steamed rice. The service is ALWAYS FAST & FRIENDLY!
author: Shana F.

description: I was invited by a dear friend to dine at Heung Yeng's a while back. I enjoyed their signature Koren chicken dish best...I crave the flavor at least once a month. The atmosphere is pleasant and I enjoy sitting by the large window watching the people go by. Give them a hit...you may get a craving too. Enjoy!
author: L. C.

description:
Since I happened to be working next door to this restaurant thought I'd do Chinese takeout for dinner tonight. Yelp reviews were raving so much about the Korean chicken I had to try it. Only ordered the Korean chicken & pot stickers (since everyone seemed to rave about that too). 

Both were jus ok for me. Since the korean chicken is fried & doused w/ all that spicy/sweet sauce, it really needs to be eaten right away (I did take out & was 15 mins away from home) by the time I got home the chicken on the bottom was soaked & soggy. The top pieces were ok, kind of a greasy dish over all. My husband  said it had that duck seasoning kind of taste that he didn't really like. Not a good dish for leftovers either. 

The potstickers didn't come w/ any special sauce so I made my own (vinegar, soy sauce, cilantro & threw in a few chili slices). They were pretty small & expected more for a $5 appetizer. 

For these 2 dishes, paid $12.37.
author: Janel H.

description:
Heung Yuen is a great, classic Cantonese style restaurant. 

The negative reviews I find here are kinda upsetting; is it the over-refined Yuppie palate at work? queasiness at actually being able to see another human being prepare your food? cultural ignorance? If you don't like greasy Chinese noodles, maybe you think the Italians put too much garlic in their food  or Mexican food overdoes the peppers. 

Go to Chinatown; look for a place where just Chinese folks are eating, with no English menu handy, go in, sit down, try to cope with that strange smoky flavor in the fried rice, the pepper that burns for a second then leaves wonderful after tastes, really fat chow fun noodles and then maybe, just maybe, you'll begin to acquire a little actual "culture". 

The prices at Heung Yuen are modest, the servings more than generous, the staff more than willing to help you explore what they offer, even to creating special dishes for you. I've been eating there for over thirty years, introduced my kids to Chinese food there and after a number of years living outside of San Francisco am still warmly welcomed by the wonderful family who work so hard to feed us all so well.
author: Allan K.

description:
* 4.5 stars! *

You can't go wrong with Heung Yuen.

Delicious, FAT portions (big tasty shrimp, too!), fair prices, cozy interior if you dine-in, nice service. Bang bang bang.

This was actually the first restaurant I ate in when I moved to the city last year. Loved it.

Fresh, zesty, fun, absolutely fulfilling food! Not the best Chinese food I've ever had in my life (taste & price-wise), but still quite good!

Hope that helps.
author: Kai S.

description: Another Yelp adventure I decided to go with this place.  It got 4 stars on Yelp so it must be good right?  Meh!  The place is a good size for a divey place.  Two dining rooms.  Service is not the best and had to wait for a menu and to order.  Prices are definitely on the low side.  The tea had a hint of of either tea bag or sink water after taste.  I guess i got used to it.  I got chicken won ton soup without noodles.  It was less than $6.  You get a small bowl with more than enough wontons.  I didn't like the bock choy though.  They left the ends on and they looked brownish/yellow which i take as either aged and unfresh.  Ends should be white.  If you want a full meal definitely get the soup with noodles, it might fill you up more.  I decided to order a rice plate to-go which was the curry chicken.  For dinner, I reheated the food and it was good.  White meat with a curry sauce that is very good.  Not salty and not too rich.  A lot of onions as usual but cooked right.  One thing that i didn't like was it lacked veggies.  I was looking for carrots at least but it had green peppers.  Potatoes would have been nice.  I'd have to say it was better than the soup.  I don't know about the 4 stars but I guess its all about the Korean Chicken everyone is talking about.  I did  notice the guy in front of me order it.  I may go back just to see what the hype is.  Until then the hype is just Ok and mediocre to me.  Just another average asian restaurant.  Not bad on the pocket though!
author: Chris S.

description:
Hole-in-the wall restaurant, an excellent choice if you're looking for REAL Chinese food outside of Chinatown. If you're used to those fancy, Americanized Chinese restaurants, then this will not be your cup of tea. Very cheap and generous portions. The sweet & sour fish fillet was the best I've ever had. 

Note: They now accept credit/debit cards.
author: Dee L.

description:
Pretty decent Chinese food. Per the rave reviews, we ordered the Korean fried chicken boneless and got a side of white rice and their Chef Special chow mein. Yes the chicken was yummy! I felt like it had more breading than meat, but that's what makes it so good, right? The chicken was fried just right, making it crispy and juicy. And that sauce. Omg that sauce is killer! I'm wondering if they'll share that recipe with me so I can whip it up at home and slather all types of meat into it. I think it's just honey and some sort of spicy sauce and crushed red peppers. The chow mein was fine. It was pretty oily and they were stingey when it came to meat and vegetables, but we still enjoyed it.  

The staff is friendly and attentive. It's certainly not a place where you'd wanna take a first date to (it was obviously a Mexican restaurant in its past life), so you can call in your order for pick up if you prefer that. Also, they're closed on Sundays.
author: Joy L.

description:
YES!!! I'M THE FIRST!!

Simply put, this is my favorite Chinese Restaurant in the Mission.

There are always plenty of tables, so you never have to worry about not finding a seat.

The food is delicious.  Try the Korean Chicken, it is by far some of the best you can find in the Mission District.  The food is also reasonably priced, which is always nice for your pocket/wallet/purse.

There are usually parking around the block somewhere, metered, but parking nonetheless.

I really can't find anything wrong with the place.  In fact, I think I may just go there tomorrow.
author: Mike V.

description:
Just ordered yesterday from my cell in the car, less than ten minutes later I was in the there walking out after paying for the food I ordered....They are super fast, super cheap and super delish!

************************************************************

Never dined in here, but love to pick up for take out!  this place just has it going on!  Having some friends over for dinner and don't want to cook, but you don't want cheesy take out.  The call up the friendly folks at Heung Yuen.  Their chow fun is off da hook and the boneless Korean chicken is TDF.  

So when your guest come over, just make sure everything is in bowls and you have pots on the stove. "why thank you, I'm glad you loved it, I've been slaving over the stove all day!"  **wink***
author: A P.

description: Pretty good and insanely quick. Walked over, ordered and 3 minutes later walked out with my food (which was not half bad!).
author: Marshall M.

description:
1 word "awesome"

I've been coming here since I was born and so has my family. This place is great/ Great quality food and in a timely manner too. The wait staff is excellent always there when you need them. im glad the turtle guy left he was a meenie but everyone else is super great. Oh did i mention the korean chicken. its to die for. please try it.
author: TINO G.

description: Probably the best Chinese food in SF but you guys really need to start delivering not only would you make more money but it will be an advantage for those of us who don't want to go all the way out to the mission for awesome Chinese food.
author: Allison M.

description:
Another timeless SF hole in the wall. I've been coming here over ten years now, my parents and grandparents over 25 years. When my family and I come for Sunday dinner, the staff know our menu selections without asking. If you speak to some of the waiters in Spanish, they even understand and are able to respond. Pretty cool if you ask me. 
 
The prices and portions are very excellent. I've got out of bed on my days off and driven to The City just for the Korean Chicken. The chef special Mongolian Beef i just as good. I found it rather interesting that much of the menu provided Spanish translation...only in The MIssion lol. 

Parking is HORRENDOUS. I prefer parking at the Mission and Bartlett garage but that's just personal preference. Eating in is great when time permits (the portions seem to be bigger that waylol) but they're pretty fast with take out. 

If you're looking for fast, cheap, delicious Chinese food - this is the place to go. Even if you're not in the area, like I said the Korean Chicken is worth the drive!!!
author: True C.

description: Quick for walk-in take-out, giant portions. Delicious "Korean" chicken wings, chef's special fried rice not bad.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Order food to go last Saturday. Crave for their BBQ Pork Rice and Korean Chicken Wing. Quality was excellent, tasteful, great amount served for price. Price was good for the food worth it. Customer Service was good and food was made quick. Recommend to people who love Chinese Food. Would come back here again.
author: Gruber T.

description:
The good:  
-Cheap Mexi Chinese Food
-Very Fast Service

The bad:    
-The food did not taste good

The ugly:    
-The food did not taste good
author: ronzilla x.

description:
Stick to the Korean Boneless Chicken (ask for it spicy), the noodles, and the potstickers. Avoid the apps generally, and the fried rice which is strangely brown and fluffy.

Also, the set menu here is only about $9 to $10 per person and is more food than you and your companions can possibly eat in one sitting.
author: Adam Z.

description: This is the best of the best when it comes to Korean / Chinese food. The Korean chicken is absolutely delicious, and the pot stickers are to die for!! everything in this restaurant is cooked fresh and with love.If you been coming here for years they always remember you. its crazy. It may not look like much from the outside but this is for sure my favorite place to eat Korean / Chinese food. Its a definite must try!! and hey if you don't like it...just don't ever go back. i will always go back to this place tho. DELICIOUS.
author: Sarah A.

description:
I have a soft spot for this place. This has been the restaurant my family has been going to for as long as I can remember eating my first portion of steamed rice... which believe me... was a long time ago. I have been spoiled by other Chinese food and can't really eat anywhere else. I'm pretty sure there's better restaurants out there, but I haven't really found one yet.

First, let me talk about the service. They treat you like a part of the family... especially my family and me. The elderly lady is REALLY nice and hospitable, and the waiters are always polite and smiling. I could probably go on about how much I really love the people there, but I'll spare you... other than share that the elderly lady gave me a box of Chinese candy when she found out I was leaving for Amsterdam for studying abroad... but I'm sure she only did that because I've been going there for so long... but anyways.

The food is great. Well, the food that my mom always orders is great. From experience, I can tell you these dishes are outstanding.
- The Sesame Chicken (my absolute favorite)
- Pork Fried Rice
- Beef Chow Mein and Chow Fun
- Orange Chicken
- Korean Beef (from what I remember when I use to eat beef)
- Pot Stickers
- Walnut Prawns

There's a lot of other dishes that are great that aren't coming to mind at this moment. It's been a while since I've been there, but when I do finally come back home and I'm in the mood for Chinese, this place is mandatory. And it looks like once I do go back, according to the peeps here, I need to try the Korean Chicken :D
author: Chris S.

description: The food is money. And the money is not alot. You and your lover can walk out satiated for $15 including tip.  Quick Cheap Tasty.
author: stuart l.

description: Cheap greasy-spoon Chinese food that you should probably drown in hot sauce and/or soy sauce. Their daily specials (which only seem to change once a week) are the most prepared food you can get for $5 in the Mission.
author: Pierre B.

description:
If you are the type of person that thinks Panda Express is authentic Chinese food, you need a reality check and check out who's cooking up your combo plate. But anyways, Heung Yuen is one the closest to authentic that you'll get outside of Chinatown. I agree with the reviews below....it is pretty greasy and the place does look a bit grungy, but like my boyfriend says "the dirty lookin' places always make really good food." (but please don't make that a rule of thumb). Back to the review: Heung Yuen does serve up some good food and their menu has almost 200 different dishes, so you have plenty to choose from. We also found out today that you can order off-menu Chinese food too! Yum!  I also recommend ordering take-out because the service is not that great when you are eating in, but they'll cook anything in 20 mins or less for you to pick up! Good place to give a try!

Recommendations: 
Korean Chicken 
Fried Whole Fish w/ Black Bean Sauce
Beef Won-Ton Soup
author: Lisa T.

description: Yeah i'm a fan of this place! Been coming here for a while and it always NEVER disappointed me. I recommend the Salt & Pepper pork chops. This place always make you feel you're welcome and the Mama san always greets you when you come in. Be aware that this place NEVER accepts Plastics (Credit Cards Or Debit Cards) so cash in king here. Just bring a eating buddy or friends with you for they give you tasty and Huge portions, also leave your belt at home for you're gonna be Fed!
author: Joel A.

description:
Ordered take-out from here a couple times. They give you pretty big portions, but it's a bit greasy at times.  I do like dining in though.

You feel like you are in a family joint when you come in.  You have the cool old Chinese chefs that walk around all badass and the grandma making pot stickers at the table.  

When I was moving out of the Mission, my folks came up from San Jo to take some of my unneccessary stuff off of my hands and we found ourselves hungry afterwards.

Mom goes  "Hey, we all want some of that excellent SF Chinese cuisine."
I told them  "We're a long ways from Chinatown and  the only place in walking distance is this Heung Yuen place and it's a bit of a gut-bomb. so you might..."
Dad: "Yeah, let's go there."
Other relatives all nod in agreement.

By the end of the meal, everyone was happy, as is usually the case with family-style Chinese.... it was like being in the suburbs all over again.  

Dine-in, it's better.
author: Neej M.

description: Never disappointed with this hole in the wall. Chefs special items are especially good!
author: Grizwald Y.

description:
I don't really know what teh story was on how i ended up in here. I think it had to do something with the fact that it is right across the street from the Lating American Club and one of my friends said they had the wings. I don't know... Anyway, I remember the wings being pretty god but being scared to drink the water. Yes, the woman was making potstickers on a table and it didn't look sanitary, at all. They have a 67 clean score on the Dept. of Health site. That's really not good... At all.

Beer was cold!
author: A W.

description:
Total hole in the wall that my family has been ordering take out from since as long as I can remember.  I looooove the boneless Korean chicken, and their greasy chow mein does the trick too! :)

I've eaten in the restaurant no more than 10 times in my lifetime- and I recommend takeout, which I've had 100 times, unless you want to see them making the potstickers/wontons on the table in front of you...I'd rather not! :)
author: Valerie A.

description: This is one of the best Chinese food places in SF. The food is cooked fresh!! Very Delicious. I was born and raised in the Mission District. Me and my family have been going here for over 20 years! I grew up on this food . I will always love this place. The older Asian woman always remembers me and what I order, which is the Korean Chicken which is my favorite dish. The potstickers are the freshest and tastiest. The pork fried rice is savory and the chow mein is great!  It's one of the many fantastic places in the city.
author: Fonzo A.

description:
Five stars! Only for their Korean Chicken and Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce. Scrumpdididleyuptious.

And yes, it is a hole in the wall, but a delicious one at that.
author: Chloe C.

description:
Neato!  A Chinese restaurant that translates its menu into Spanish!  I wonder if you can even order en Espanol... I don't know why I get such a kick out of this cultural synthesis, but something about reading "Camarones al estilo Kung Pao" makes me grin.  Hungrily.

Six bucks and under ten minutes brought me all the Chicken Chow Fun I could eat -- and that's really quite a lot.  The food is not distinguished or gourmet by any stretch, but it's good solid tasty edible food, the price is right, and the people are nice.

** CASH ONLY. **
author: Eric O.

description:
Strictly for the Broccoli Beef! The fam loves them the Korean Chicken, but I've had better (not that it tastes bad).

And yeah it's true it's not a great looking location, but it's obvious people come for the food!!!

Never been in the bathroom, not sure if I want, too..but because they are a busy spot it comforts me that the food is fresh!
author: M R.

description: Great food! Korean Chix is a must and the shrimp chow mein! Beef broccoli and won ton soup are great too! Pick the white rice over the fried. Great to bring home for parties, just got Korean chix , shrimp chow mein, and beef broccoil 4 my b-day and it was a hit! The service is great, I know them since I was little, the old lady is the best! It's a family hot spot!
author: Ladyreyes R.

description:
Simply the best Chinese food I've ever had. The service is excellent, the quality of food is outstanding, the staff is friendly & nice, and the prices are good.

This used to be our neighborhood restaurant, until my family moved about 8 years ago. My mom is currently in the hospital, so we've been coming up to SF to see her & started eating here again. They remembered us! After 8 years! They remembered what we ordered and what we liked! Amazing!

The rice is excellent. Not greasy at all. The pork in the pork fried rice is chopped very small and seasoned so nicely. The spicy green beans are excellent (firm, not mushy and floppy). My husband *loves* their fried prawns and prawn fried rice. Even the fortune cookies taste good (not stale like many restaurants)!

My two youngest kids haven't always embraced Chinese cuisine, but whenever we go to Hueng Yuen they scarf everything down and consistently comment about how great the food is. It's *very* family friendly!
author: Marie S.

description: Food here is amazing. The Korean Chicken is probably the best thing on their menu, but everything else doesn't fall too short behind it. It doesn't get a five-star review because the food here can be a bit overpriced, but it doesn't stop me from coming here at least 2 a month. Everyone here is very friendly and never fail to smile at me. Always recommend this place to a friend.
author: Sheryl F.

description: So good! One dish feeds both my husband and I. And the staff is nice! The hostess even remembered our order from the first time! And the prices can't be beat!
author: Chelsey S.

description:
Yummy! I could only bring myself to write this right after I ate their takeout because it would be unfair self torture otherwise! I looooove this place. My family has been going to this spot since I can remember.  When I say family, that includes my huge collection of grandparents, aunts uncles and cousins. The service there is the best because they treat you like family. In fact, when I arrive, they always tell me something like, " Oh, your uncle came earlier and we made him a great clay pot,"  I have not glanced at a menu in years because the lady who takes our order remembers exactly what we like or she suggests something we haven't had before. When my dad goes, my dad just says, "I feel like having something seafood" and they whip something up in the back for him so good that it makes no appearance in the menu. 

Everything here is good, even if it's not the most glamorous of places, you know people come here for the food. In all the years I have been going there, this place has changed very little as far as staff and surroundings go.... It's definitely a place of comfort.  I keep going to other places but nobody beats their yummy food, prices and service . Good place to go with the family and not worry about making a mess.
author: Irene A.

description: Based on the recommendation of a friend, I tried the Korean Chicken and it was awesome. We only order one other dish, the Mixed Vegetable Chow Mein and it was pretty bland.
author: John F.

description: Korean Chicken. Let the sugary sauce drizzle over your fried rice, or chow mein and you'll be all smiles when you're done.
author: Bonene G.

description: If you look up dirty, greasy chinese food in the food dictionary this is what you will find.  Its a dirty hole in the wall that serves up dirty cantonese food.  I usually come every day for lunch during the week and this place is always packed.  The locals know where all the good cheap eats are located.  I would only eat here if you live or work in the area.
author: Fatty A.

description: I'm on a quest to find good Chinese noodle soups in the Mission. I decided to check this place out after reading the Yelp reviews. I ordered won ton noddle soup, to go. I was disappointed to see that the noodles were actually the fat noodles, like in chow mein. It should be the thinner kind! Oh wells, too late now. The server was really nice and he was even nicer when he said I owed him $5.26! Chowed down on it at work and it ended up to be alright. It's not bad, but my quest continues...
author: Freckles H.

description: That's 3 stars for their Chow Mein which is really good! Even I was surprised as I had previously tried their appetizers (pot stickers & spring egg rolls) that were bland, and spare ribs with black bean sauce that was more on the "soupy" side. Chow mein was tasty and chewy. So far, my husband and I have been dining in and it does get crowded. Basic service, basic interior, basic everything. Plus it's right across the laundromat (where we do our laundry and walk across to this resto to grab a quick, cheap bite to eat).
author: Cecilia A.

description: I always got to this place for the Beef Wonton Soup...I can't get enough. $5.26 for take out. When the waiters see me come in with my backpack they always ask me, "Beef Wonton Soup?" LOL They know me so well. Besides the soup I also like their Spring Rolls, Korean Shrimp, Pot Stickers, and the Beef and Broccoli. Oh and they're closed Sundays and are Cash only which sucks sometimes.
author: Jennifer E.

description:
I'm not sure where all of thes positive reviews are coming from, I'll have to try th koreanchicken or shrimp and rerate it, BUT.

I feel like some of these positive reviews might be bullshit because they say it is "cheap".  It is actually quite expenive for a chinese restaurant.

I have tried all of the cheap items here and they all suck.

I really wouldnt order anything here except the koren chiken or shrimp and i haven' even tried that yet.  I just know that most  of the itmes are expensive and disgusting.
author: Henry C.

description:
I work a block a way....and today's the second time I've tried this place. 

Last time, I had a super oily, not-so-tasty rendition of Tofu with Green Beans and Black Bean Sauce. 

And today--I had a super-duper-oily, bland Eggplant with Garlic Sauce that's giving me a stomach ache. I'll try one more time--and then I'm through.

Oh Heung Yuen, I wish you were better.
author: Tara R.

description:
I am writing this review for one reason, and one reason alone. Korean Chicken. I was introduced to this masterpiece by a good friend of mine. I had no reason to doubt his taste, but I did when I found myself going to this dumpy little restaurant across the street from Boogaloos. I questioned it "Are you sure about this? Last thing I need is gnarly mudbutt."

This chicken is amazing, for about 8 bucks you can get more rice and chicken than you can eat. The spicy version of it has the right amount of spice and sweetness. I love this place, for no other reason than the Korean Chicken.
author: Arnold S.

description: great friendly service , the food woud have been the best if it wasn't so oily and greasy but than again thats the point of chinese food, mangolian beef is delicious, looking forward to try different things, couldve been 4 stars if it wasnt for that oil dripping from every where .
author: NAEL K.

description: Everyone is right....the Korean Chicken is great., but you should also try the Korean Shrimp.  It is made exactly like the chicken and it too is great! Usually I call in my order and it's ready in 10 minutes.  You can't beat that.
author: Bert Z.

description: I was introduced to this place back in my college days by my friend that grew up in the Mission.  The one and only thing I had here was the Korean Chicken, OMG so fricking good.  Crunchy, sweet but not in a traditional sweet and sour way.  Dang its been forever but I must make it back soon.
author: La C.

description: Cheap Chinese food in the Mission with very fast service (take-out order was ready in less than 10 minutes). The food isn't that great as I expected from the past reviews, and everything I ordered was covered in loads of "sauce" which didn't make it any more appetizing.  However, the restaurant was packed with old Latin couples and families, so I'm guessing it's one of the better choices for cheap Chinese food in the Mission. I'm sure it beats Chinese Food & Donuts on 24th & Mission, which I'd never step foot in.
author: Zell C.

description:
i'd assume, by the fact that the place is always empty, that anyone on foot would know better than to stop to eat here. i'm writing this review more for the folks who get a menu tacked to their door and think, "why not try it for delivery, sight-unseen?"  

the "why not" answer is easy... the food (in my experience) was gross.  while i'm intrigued by one reviewer's comments on the pot stickers, i just can't fathom eating here again.  i had something really basic, likely sesame chicken, as that's my go-to at any unfamiliar chinese restaurant.  the chicken was... how to say... stringy, chewy, lathered in too much sauce.

while there are not many good options for chinese in the mission, i'd advise you to skip this one (try Yum Yum House or get delivery from Jasmine Tea House, they're both quite good).
author: Brady W.

description:
I work in an office down the street, and 90% of the time we go out for lunch with the entire crew, we come here.  Maybe 95%.

It's not the best food in the city or anything, but there's a HUGE menu, it's cheap, it's quick, and the service is very friendly (helps if you go almost every day).  

Their lunch special is some of the best deals round.  Fried rice will feed a family of 18 for under $5.  Their noodle wonton soup is great on a cold day.  Their salt-baked dishes are FANTASTIC.  It's not on the menu, but try a side of Chinese broccoli with garlic sauce.  Other favorites are Korean Chicken and pot stickers.

UPDATE: Spare Ribs in Black Bean sauce over rice.  Trust me.
author: K H.

description:
An ok place. Unfortunately, better than most the Chinese alternatives in this area, so I find myself going back there occasionally in spite of myself. Someone really needs to start a consistently good Chinese take-out restaurant around 21st-24th and Mission and put all these mediocre places out of business.

The food is uneven, ranging from decent to unacceptable (e.g., noodles that are partially raw, deep fried chicken that is sufficiently undercooked to have dough oozing out of it when you bite into it, etc.).

The service is likewise inconsistent. One guy is incredibly smilely and nice, while another guy acts like you're an idiot when you can't read his mind (to know, e.g., that they're out of an ingredient or closing 15 minutes before their stated closing time).

I find the potstickers to be ok--worth getting if you're there, but not worth going out of the way to get them. They're just kinda normal potstickers that you'd get in a restaurant--certainly above frozen quality, but nothing to dream about.
author: Jared B.

description: 4 stars for their Korean Chicken only. I don't get it spicy because my other half can't hang with spicy. Beats me why a Chinese restaurant makes such a yummy "Korean" chicken, but it is damn good.
author: christine t.

description:
7/23/2009, take out

korean chicken -- sugar, coloring agent overloaded sauce. get better version in Sunset area.

house chowmein  -- tasteless, noodles is rough.

your average chinese takeout junk fast food joint.
author: Yi S.

description: I was introduced to chinese food at this restaurant at the age of 12.  Have loved it ever since.  The beef won ton soup is great! So is the chef's special chow mein and the Korean beef.  The portions are generous, the prices are perfect, the staff helpful.  If you want something elegant, spacious and refined this restaurant is NOT for you! But if you like good chinese food for good prices and the best Korean chicken then give it a try! Oh and try the take-out... It literally took me 8 minutes to order, go and pick up!...
author: Laura C.

description: As my profile states, I always say that I'm going to start yelping one day. Well boys and girls....today is that day. And what better place to start with than the one I have been frequenting for as long as I can remember. And here I thought I'd be the first to review this place not the 18th. It seems people have found my "my little hole in the wall can't go wrong with the korean chicken". Really, that's what I call it. Anyways, the actual review is short... all five stars for the korean chicken. Go for the spanish speaking chinese waiters; stay for the korean chicken.
author: Brent A.

description: They make the best cubed beef Chinese dish I've ever had. (Sorry, I misplaced the menu so I can't name but trust me it's good with those little love-me-tenderloins.) Their Emperor's Chicken [sic-again, no menu], potstickers, fried rice, and other dishes always leave me satisfied too. It's not easy for parking amidst the Mission hipsteristas but you can always do the buddy-system with someone who grab it while you tend the car. The restaurant's ambience resembles a senior-facility cafeteria - not recommended (no offense, Grandma)! The matron of the establishment always smiles and the take-out always leaves me with a smile back at home.
author: Geo G.

description: a bit bland, but nice people, and I like they they negotiated with me when I said the $17 they wanted to charge me for Korean chicken, steamed vegetables, and rice was way too much.
author: James R.

description: A classic for my family, I remember eating here when I was little with the extended family. The food is good, somtimes a little greasy but isn't all Chinese food? We've eaten here and ordered out, both are great. The owner of the place remembers my order when I call it in and she is always friendly.
author: Gabriela R.

description: If only people would request that no msg be used in their food, this place would be able to change for the better. I've tried, but my voice is too small. It seems that the rest of the clientele love the msg piled on in buckets. This place is so unpretentious. There is so much potential here. I love the shrimp wonton soup, but they use so much msg that I can't eat it. Otherwise, the flavor is authentic. If you really want to eat real Chinese, don't order the typical American stuff like kung pao chicken or sweet and sour pork- that is NOT Chinese food. Order the steamed fish or vegetable for the day with a simple garlic or oyster sauce. I wish they had brown rice. The employees are responsive and very genial. I come here any day I feel like having a decent meal and to be served. Just know that you don't have to accept greasy food, you can ask for them to adjust the dish and they will happily oblige.
author: kim y.
